name: Albino Plate
notes:
Notes
Dropped by the rare boss White Pale, but not very useful. Even though the similar name to Molten Plate, Frozen Plate and Divine Plate it has a very different look.

name: Amazon Armor
notes:
Notes
It is only dropped during orc raids on Femor Hills. It is less rare than the Amazon Shield, but still would take you 5 years on average to loot one if you killed every orc raid occurring. It is therefore extremely valuable. It is part of the Amazon Set.

name: Arcane Dragon Robe
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Ball Gown
notes:
Notes
This item is extremely rare. One was received by Queen of Light II thanks to what is believed to be a major bug report. Savage Demon won this rare item from a competition between Tutors. Moreover, there is a ball gown displayed on a desk in the fashion shop of Hugo in Venore.

name: Bear Skin
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Belted Cape
notes:
Notes
A very good armor for low level Paladins since it isn't too expensive, has the same armor value as the Plate Armor and is really light.

name: Blue Robe
notes:
Notes
It's a decent armor for anyone looking to save capacity. It can be used by any vocation but there are usually better armors available.

Paladins can use Paladin Armor.
Druids and Sorcerers can use Ethno Coat, Spirit Cloak, Focus Cape.
Knights can use Golden Armor, Dragon Scale Mail, Demon Armor.
It may be a good option for a low-level knight who only blocks more damage in armor upgrades, while the other vocations improve their skills to deal more damage. The extra capacity will allow the knight to carry more potions.
It was very attractive for Mages before the Summer Update 2008. Most mages now prefer to use a Spirit Cloak or Focus Cape for the extra Magic Level although Spirit Cloaks are heavier and have less defense and Focus Capes have less defense but is lighter. On the Test Server (8.2), Blue Robe added an extra Magic Level, however the convenience was removed after the Test Server. Many people believed that these robes increased magic damage by 25%, however this rumor was (and is) false.
Obtainable in the Medusa Shield Quest.

name: Brass Armor
notes:
Notes
Most likely the first chest armor players get on Main. Part of the Brass Set. This can also be gotten by unrusting a Heavily Rusted Armor, Rusted Armor or Slightly Rusted Armor. Knights can also get this armor on the Island of Destiny and in Dawnport. Due to a bug, the armor was also briefly brought to Rookgaard from Dawnport.

name: Broken Iks Cuirass
notes:
Notes
This item is one of the four required to obtain the first addon for the Ancient Aucar Outfits.

name: Buckle
notes:
Notes
It has the same armor as Knight Armor but weighs much less, and may be a nice substitute for a knight or paladin who cannot yet afford a Crown Armor or Paladin Armor.

name: Burial Shroud
notes:
Notes
Part of the Feaster of Souls Quest.

name: Calopteryx Cape
notes:
Notes
The best armor for Druids and Sorcerers of level 80-99.

name: Cape
notes:
Notes
This cape is used as an armor, looks the same as The Rain Coat.

name: Chain Armor
notes:
Notes
The best armor in Rookgaard, although some people still prefer to use the Studded Armor because it is lighter. In Main it's good to stuff in Lootbags. Part of the Chain Set. This can also be gotten by unrusting a Heavily Rusted Armor and Rusted Armor.
Obtainable in the Bear Room Quest, in Rookgaard.

name: Chaos Critical Dice (Replica)
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Coat
notes:
Notes
None.
Obtainable in The Beginning Quest.

name: Crown Armor
notes:
Notes
Part of the Crown Set.
After the Update 8.4, the Crown Armor became for knights and paladins only. This can also be gotten by using a Flask of Rust Remover on Rusted Armor or Slightly Rusted Armor.
Good armor for mid level Knights, some will prefer to use the Knight Armor, which has 1 arm less and is cheap, Paladins should prefer to use a Paladin Armor. The next upgrade should be a Golden Armor.
It can be traded for a Piece of Royal Steel with A Sweaty Cyclops. It can be obtained through the Black Knight Quest.

name: Crystalline Armor
notes:
Notes
It gives 3% ice protection, but increases damage taken from energy by 3%. Used to be very expensive, but the price decreased because Sea Serpents drop it.
Can be gotten out of a Mucus Plug.

name: Dark Armor
notes:
Notes
Same as Plate Armor but this is more expensive and rare. Part of the Dark Set.

Can be obtained through the Dark Armor Quest.

name: Dark Lord's Cape
notes:
Notes
Since this Armor drops from Morgaroth, it is not an item commonly seen or used by players.

name: Dauntless Dragon Scale Armor

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +3, axe fighting +3, club fighting +3

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Dawnfire Sherwani
notes:
Notes
It's part of the Naga Set.

name: Demon Armor
notes:
Notes
Since the Update 8.4 this is the strongest armor without level restrictions for mages as they can no longer use Magic Plate Armor. Part of the Demon Set.
Obtainable in the Annihilator Quest.

name: Depth Lorica
notes:
Notes
Part of the Depth Set. It's the best armor for Paladins between levels 150 and 199. Later on can still be a viable option, especially in hunting areas where Death Damage is secondary or tertiary damage source.

name: Divine Plate
notes:
Notes
Only obtainable since Christmas Update 2008. It gives 10% death protection, but increases damage taken from holy by 10%. It is only available for Paladins.

name: Doublet
notes:
Notes
Good for early levels on Rookgaard, try to obtain this armor as soon as possible. If you can, go for it after you enter Rookgaard.
Obtainable in the Doublet Quest.

name: Dragon Robe
notes:
Notes
It gives 12% fire protection, but increases damage taken from ice by 12%.
Obtainable in the The Elemental Spheres Quest.

name: Dragon Scale Mail
notes:
Notes
Before the Update 8.4, this armor was the third best armor in Tibia. Now, there are more armors better than this one. Part of the Dragon Set. It was thought that it can also be gotten by unrusting a Slightly Rusted Armor but this has been proven false.
Needed for an addon of Wizard Outfits.

name: Dream Shroud
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Dwarven Armor
notes:
Notes
It's a very rare armor because the item required to obtain the armor can only be looted in a specific place. This armor can block the same physical damage as Magic Plate Armor but only if you get physical hits of 119 or more, so you will have to fight stronger monsters to make this armor block as good as Magic Plate Armor. Part of the Dwarven Set.
Obtainable through Sam's Old Backpack Quest.

name: Earthborn Titan Armor
notes:
Notes
It gives 5% earth protection, but increases damage taken from fire by 5%. Extremely rare armor, can only be seen in a few worlds. This armor is so valuable because of the axe fighting bonus. 

    An Earthborn Titan Armor on Candia

name: Earthheart Cuirass
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Earthheart Hauberk
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Earthheart Platemail
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Earthmind Raiment
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Earthsoul Tabard
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Eldritch Cuirass
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Elite Draken Mail
notes:
Notes
This armor gives  purple light and gives +10 Speed. It has the same speed boost as Zaoan Armor, but the same armor as Dragon Scale Mail. However useful this armor may seem, most high level Paladins will generally wear Master Archer's Armor because of its skill boost and most high level Knights will wear whatever armor gives them a boost towards their weapon, or their shielding. (I.e. Windborn Colossus Armor, and Fireborn Giant Armor for weapons, or Ornate Chestplate for shielding.)

name: Elven Mail
notes:
Notes
This is currently the only armor in the game with three Imbuing slots. This makes it highly sought-after, especially by high-level players who need two elemental protection imbues on places such as the Soul War Quest areas.

name: Embrace of Nature
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Ethno Coat
notes:
Notes
This is one of three Mage's armors that increases Magic Level by 1, yet carries no minimum Level requirements. Compared to either a Focus Cape or a Spirit Cloak, this is the worst of the three as it provides the lowest protection. Only Sorcerers and Druids may use them.

name: Falcon Plate
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Fireborn Giant Armor
notes:
Notes
It gives 5% protection against fire, but also increases damage taken from ice attacks by 5%. This armor also raises your Sword Fighting skill by 2.
Obtainable in the The Inquisition Quest.

name: Fireheart Cuirass
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Fireheart Hauberk
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Fireheart Platemail
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Firemind Raiment
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Firesoul Tabard
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Flower Dress
notes:
Notes
Elegant dress made of flowers, they are reasonably rare and a fine decoration. For many people these dresses are valuable. It was first seen on June 1, 2009.  See also: Dryad Set

name: Focus Cape
notes:
Notes
This is one of three Mage's armors that increases Magic Level by 1, yet carries no minimum Level requirements. Compared to either an Ethno Coat or a Spirit Cloak, this is the best of the three as it is the lightest and affords the highest armor rating. Only Sorcerers and Druids may use them. A good armor for lower level mages as it is affordable and increases a magic level.

name: Frostheart Cuirass
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Frostheart Hauberk
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Frostheart Platemail
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Frostmind Raiment
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Frostsoul Tabard
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Frozen Plate
notes:
Notes
It gives 7% of ice protection, but increases damage taken from energy by 7%. It is only available for Paladins.
It was a very rare loot from Sea Serpents, but it got removed in a later patch. There were plenty of them around, but in some game worlds this item became very rare. After it could only be looted by Ghazbaran and Leviathan, it became a valuable item.

name: Fur Armor
notes:
Notes
This furry armor will keep you warm even during the cold winter nights.

name: Furious Frock
notes:
Notes
It has the same attributes as Royal Scale Robe, except that the furious frock weighs less.

name: Ghost Chestplate
notes:
Notes
Very popular armor due its versality and relatively low price. It is not uncommon for paladins to keep few of them imbued with different elemental protections.

name: Gill Coat
notes:
Notes
Part of the Gill Set

name: Girl's Dress
notes:
Notes
Not suitable for males to use.

name: Glacier Robe
notes:
Notes
It gives 8% protection from Ice Damage, but increases damage taken from Energy by 8%.
It's useful to wear when hunting monsters that use ice attacks. It is part of the Glacier Set.

name: Glooth Cape
notes:
Notes
Part of the Glooth Set.

name: Gnome Armor
notes:
Notes
Currently second best paladin armor. Recommended especially in hunting grounds where energy is secondary or tertiary damage source.

name: Golden Armor
notes:
Notes
Tenth best armor, part of the Golden Set.
After the Update 8.4, the Golden Armor became for knights and paladins only. This can also be gotten by unrusting a Slightly Rusted Armor.
Obtainable through the Behemoth Quest.

name: Goo Shell
notes:
Notes
It's a rare armor because it's only dropped by the rare boss Weakened Shlorg.

name: Green Demon Armor
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Green Tunic
notes:
Notes
Not very useful.

150 of these can be traded with Irmana for a Green Piece of Cloth.

name: Greenwood Coat
notes:
Notes
It gives 12% earth protection, but increases damage taken from fire by 12%. 
Obtainable in the The Elemental Spheres Quest.

name: Heat Core
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Heavy Metal T-Shirt
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Boogey to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. Before introduction of the Swan Feather Cloak, it used to be the lightest Armor in the game. It remains as the lightest armor which can be imbued.
It looks the same as a Pirate Tapestry.
There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Hibiscus Dress
notes:
Notes
Popular because of its debonair look, often used as decoration or Valentine's Day present.

name: Jacket
notes:
Notes
None.
Can be obtained by skipping The Beginning Quest.

name: Knight Armor
notes:
Notes
Part of the Knight Set.
After the Update 8.4, the Knight Armor became for knights and paladins only.
Paladins are recommended to wear Paladin Armor instead as they save 55 oz of capacity and gain +2 Distance Fighting, but as this is more expensive some choose to use the Knight Armor until they can afford it later.
Knight Armors can also be obtained by using a Rust Remover on a Rusted Armor or on a Slightly Rusted Armor.
Obtainable in the Orc Fortress Quest.

name: Lavos Armor

attributes.Value: 150,000 - 300,000 on Optional PvP worlds. 500,000+ on Open PvP and Hardcore PvP worlds gp

notes:
Notes
It gives 3% fire protection, but also increases damage taken from ice by 3%. Mainly used as a deco due to it's value - on many worlds it's more expensive than Fireborn Giant Armor.  It is still a very rare item on most servers due to Annihilon being hard to hunt on Open PvP and Hardcore PvP servers.

name: Leather Armor
notes:
Notes
Good for early levels on Rookgaard. Part of the Leather Set.

name: Leather Harness
notes:
Notes
New item implemented in the Winter Update 2012.

name: Leopard Armor
notes:
Notes
This armor is a rare drop from Assassins. It's pretty similar to a Scale Armor, but is 10 ounces lighter; which raises its price.

name: Lightning Robe
notes:
Notes
It gives 8% protection from Energy Damage, but increases damage taken from Earth by 8%. Even though it has the same armor and only weighs 0.5oz more than Blue Robe it's extremely hard to sell since it has a level 50 requirement; this, plus being "easy" to loot compared to other elemental equipment, makes it cheap. It's part of the Lightning Set.

name: Lion Plate

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +3, club fighting +3, axe fighting +3

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Living Armor
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Love Elixir (Replica)
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Magic Plate Armor
notes:
Notes
Magic Plate Armor, also commonly known as "MPA" or "e-plate" (Enchanted Plate Armor), is the third best armor in Tibia for knights and known to be cheaper in older Game Worlds. After Christmas Update 2008, this armor became for knights and paladins only. On the Winter Update 2011, the Ornate Chestplate was introduced with an armor value 16, a bonus of 3 extra shielding skills and 8% protection to physical, but it's only for knights level 200 or higher. However, another better armor than this is the Royal Draken Mail, which is more accessible nowadays.

name: Magician's Robe
notes:
Notes
It is given to Sorcerers and Druids in the Island of Destiny and in Dawnport.

name: Magma Coat
notes:
Notes
It gives 8% protection from Fire Damage, but increases damage taken from Ice by 8%. It is part of the Magma Set.

name: Mammoth Fur Cape
notes:
Notes
The Mage's alternative to Plate Armor. However, Mages should not use this armor as for around same price, a player can get the Focus Cape which is 1 arm less, 1 oz but also +1 Magic Level. A low level Knight may use this armor to save on capacity, but should consider the Blue Robe; for about 4,000 gp more, players receive an extra 1 armor for only 2 ozs heavier.

name: Master Archer's Armor
notes:
Notes
It's the best offensive armor available for Paladins below level 150, when it's outclassed by the Depth Lorica. It has a high Distance Fighting boost but it lacks protective properties other than its armor and only has one imbuing slot, which is a serious disadvantage at higher levels. 
Obtainable in The Inquisition Quest.

name: Merudri Battle Mail
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Midnight Tunic
notes:
Notes
It's part of the Naga Set.

name: Molten Plate
notes:
Notes
It gives 7% fire protection, but increases damage taken from ice by 7%. It is only available for Paladins. First looted in Azura (05/02/2009) by the guild Wanted. It's a very rare item, but exists on several worlds.

name: Mooh'tah Plate
notes:
Notes
A good armor for low level Knights and Paladins.

name: Mutated Skin Armor
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Mystical Dragon Robe
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Native Armor
notes:
Notes
It can be seen in the Pythius The Rotten's treasure room. Its data can be found in the Market.

Native Armor with other rares

name: Noble Armor
notes:
Notes
The next step up from a Plate Armor, commonly used a short time before getting Knight Armor or Crown Armor.
Obtained from the Noble Armor Quest.

name: Oceanborn Leviathan Armor
notes:
Notes
Was first looted from Ghazbaran in Lucera by Ticones, on New Year's Eve.

name: Old Cape
notes:
Notes

Reward of A Father's Burden Quest. This item may be given to the Cranky Lizard Crone in exchange for the first addon of the Wayfarer Outfits.

name: Ornate Chestplate
notes:
Notes
It was the best Armor available in game until the implementation of the Falcon Plate. Nevertheless, it's still the best Armor for Knights between the levels 200 and 300 and much cheaper than the Falcon Plate. Part of the Ornate Set.

name: Ornate Testtplate
notes:
Notes
This is believed to be an Unobtainable Item. It's name and looks are a play on Ornate Chestplate.

name: Pair of Old Bracers
notes:
Notes
It is one of the few creature items that is wearable.

name: Paladin Armor
notes:
Notes
It increases your Distance Fighting by 2.
This is the third best armor of those available exclusively for paladins in Tibia. This can also be obtained by unrusting a Rusted Armor. It's a good armor for mid-level paladins. Most paladins use this Armor until they can afford a Master Archer's Armor.

name: Pirate Shirt
notes:
Notes
A part of the Pirate Set.
Looks similar to Lethal Lissy's Shirt.

Needed for the Meriana Quest.

name: Plate Armor
notes:
Notes
This armor is used by mostly all players in lower levels, because it's easy to get and provides good defense. It is the next armor to get after Scale Armor.
For a mage, the more suitable armor with same defense is a Mammoth Fur Cape. Knights should save for a noble or knight armor. Paladins should buy a Belted Cape which has the same defense but is much lighter. This can also be gotten by unrusting a Heavily Rusted Armor, Rusted Armor or Slightly Rusted Armor.
Can be obtained in the Plate Armor Quest.

name: Prismatic Armor
notes:
Notes
Part of the Prismatic Set. Best blocking (physical) armor for paladins.

name: Ranger's Cloak
notes:
Notes
The first chest item Paladins receive on the Isle of Destiny. It can also be bought in the mainland from Rudolph on Edron.

name: Red Robe
notes:
Notes
Before the implementation of Pirate Ghosts and Adepts of the Cult in 2006, this item was considered very rare and valuable.

Can be traded to Irmana for a Red Piece of Cloth.

name: Red Tunic
notes:
Notes
It used to be on display at Santa's House on Vega.
It's believed to be an Unobtainable Item.

Red Tunic in old Santa's House

name: Robe of the Ice Queen
notes:
Notes
It is a druid only robe that provides 12% ice protection, but causes the wearer to receive 12% more damage from energy. It has 4% more protection from ice and -4% from energy than the Glacier Robe. It is dropped by Ghazbaran, first time seen on Guardia.

name: Robe of the Underworld
notes:
Notes
It gives 12% death protection, but increases damage taken from holy by 12%. It's often used on pvp servers to reduce damage taken from Sudden Death runes.
Obtainable in the The Inquisition Quest.

name: Royal Draken Mail
notes:
Notes
This is the best armor available for physical defense for knights below level 200 since they cannot wear an Ornate Chestplate.
Obtained through the Wrath of the Emperor Quest.

name: Royal Scale Robe
notes:
Notes
During a Test Server, this robe gave +20% protection against Mana Drain but this feature was replaced to Magic level +2.
Obtained through the Wrath of the Emperor Quest.

name: Scale Armor
notes:
Notes
Scale Armor is often among a player's first purchases upon reaching the mainland.  Therefore, it is part of the so-called Noob Set. Rumor has it that it is also the armor of Sunrise (on Rookgaard). This can also be gotten by unrusting a Heavily Rusted Armor and Rusted Armor.
Obtainable in the Scale Armor Quest.

name: Simple Dress
notes:
Notes
Looks the same as a Spectral Dress and a Worn Dress.

name: Skullcracker Armor
notes:
Notes
It gives 5% death protection, but increases damage taken from holy by 5%. Compare with Yalahari Armor, which gives 2% less resistance to death for 2 more armor. In most cases against death-damaging creatures, this armor will reduce more damage than Yalahari Armor.

name: Soulmantle
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Armors for Sorcerers in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Soulshell
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Armors for Paladins in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Soulshroud
notes:
Notes
Part of the Soul Set and one of the best Armors for Druids in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Spectral Dress
notes:
Notes
Looks the same as a Simple Dress and a Worn Dress.
Item temporarily obtained in the Explorer Society Quest. You cannot buy this item from Black Bert in order to skip the mission, you must have obtained it yourself before.

name: Spellweaver's Robe
notes:
Notes
Somewhat better than a Lightning Robe.

name: Spirit Cloak
notes:
Notes
This is one of three Mage's armors that increases Magic Level by 1, yet carries no minimum Level requirements. Compared to either a Focus Cape or an Ethno Coat, this armor falls in the middle of the bunch in terms of protection, but it is the heaviest. Only Sorcerers and Druids may use them.

name: Spiritthorn Armor

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +4, axe fighting +4, club fighting +4, 19 damage reflection

notes:
Notes
Part of the Spiritthorn Set. It is a possible reward of the Primal Ordeal Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Primal Set through the Hazard System.
It has Damage Reflection.

name: Stoic Iks Chestplate
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Stoic Iks Cuirass
notes:
Notes
Can not be imbued with Lich Shroud.

name: Studded Armor
notes:
Notes
A good armor for medium levels in Rookgaard. Part of the Studded Set.

name: Summer Dress
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Swamplair Armor
notes:
Notes
It gives 3% earth protection, but increases damage taken from fire by 3%.

name: Swan Feather Cloak
notes:
Notes
Reward from the Threatened Dreams Quest.

name: Terra Mantle
notes:
Notes
It gives 8% protection from Earth Damage but increases damage taken from Fire by 8%. Part of the Terra Set.

name: The Rain Coat
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Mephiles to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him. It can be used every 5 minutes if you're wearing it.It looks the same as a Cape.When you use it, the Thunderstorm Single Field Effect appears on you. 
There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Thunderheart Cuirass
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Thunderheart Hauberk
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Thunderheart Platemail
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Thundermind Raiment
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Thundersoul Tabard
notes:
Notes
Can be bought from Cledwyn for 100 Silver Tokens.

name: Toga Mortis
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Traditional Shirt
notes:
Notes
Part of the Traditional Set.
Obtained by facing the Orger Treasure for the first time in your second edition of Orcsoberfest.

name: Tunic
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Unerring Dragon Scale Armor
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Velvet Mantle
notes:
Notes
The drop was introduced in Update 8.42. This armor was looted on Astera in the first Ferumbras killed in this world, you can see the owners in the image.

name: Voltage Armor
notes:
Notes
It gives 3% energy protection, but increases damage taken from earth by 3%.

name: White Dress
notes:
Notes
One can be seen on the upper floor of Venores furniture shop. Little is known about this item. Rumor says it is a unique item and only one exist all over Tibia, gifted from CipSoft's founders to a couple of Gamemasters for their wedding. 
It is believed to be an Unobtainable Item.

name: Windborn Colossus Armor
notes:
Notes
Obtainable in the The Elemental Spheres Quest.

name: Witchhunter's Coat
notes:
Notes
It gives 2% death protection, but increases damage taken from holy by 2%. It is still unobtainable in game, it was just used in a test server.

name: Yalahari Armor
notes:
Notes
This item was implemented in the Christmas Update 2008. Part of the Yalahari Set. Before a minor content fix its armor value was 17 and it had +5% protection to death. Good choice for a midlevel knight, because it has more armor than a Dragon Scale Mail and much cheaper than a Magic Plate Armor.
Obtained through the In Service of Yalahar Quest.

name: Zaoan Armor
notes:
Notes
Part of the Zaoan Set. This armor gives a 10 level bonus to speed when used.

name: Zaoan Monk Robe
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Zaoan Robe
notes:
Notes
It has a better fire reduction than a Magma Coat.
